intro: Hiraea bierosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hiraea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
